intro: Phyllanthus neilgherrensis, commonly known as the Himalayan phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain, thriving in cool and moist conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance. Phyllanthus neilgherrensis is also noted for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
